009package Ch24_NonRigidMatching;
010
011import java.awt.Color;
012import java.awt.Rectangle;
013import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
014import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
015import java.util.Random;
016
017import ij.IJ;
018import ij.ImagePlus;
019import ij.gui.Overlay;
020import ij.gui.Roi;
021import ij.gui.ShapeRoi;
022import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
023import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
024import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
026import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
027import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
028import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.ProjectiveMapping2D;
029import imagingbook.common.image.matching.lucaskanade.ImageExtractor;
030import imagingbook.common.image.matching.lucaskanade.LucasKanadeForwardMatcher;
031import imagingbook.common.image.matching.lucaskanade.LucasKanadeInverseMatcher;
032import imagingbook.common.image.matching.lucaskanade.LucasKanadeMatcher;
033import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
034import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
035
036
037/**
038 * This ImageJ plugin is a minimalistic example of using the Lucas-Kanade
039 * matchers. It performs a single test run on the current image, which is used
040 * as the search image I. A rectangular selection is required, which is used 
041 * to calculate the initial mapping (Tinit) for the matcher. This is where the 
042 * search starts. 
043 * The reference image R is extracted from I out of a warped patch, which is 
044 * obtained by perturbing (adding Gaussian noise with specified sigma) the 
045 * corners of the selected ROI. Note that the disturbance is applied to all 4 
046 * corners of the ROI, thus only a projective (4-point homography) warp can 
047 * recover an accurate match!
048 * Note that the plotted boundaries are 1 pixel smaller (in x/y) than the original
049 * ROI, because the original quad vertices are assumed to be positioned at pixel 
050 * centers. Thus if the ROI is 2 pixels wide, the corresponding quad only has width 1.
051 * 
052 * <p>The following steps are performed:</p>
053 * <ul>
054 * <li>Step 0: Create the search image I.</li>
055 * <li>Step 1: Get the rectangle of the ROI, create the (empty) reference image R of the same size.</li>
056 * <li>Step 2: Get the corner points (Q) of the ROI.</li>
057 * <li>Step 3: Perturb the ROI corners to form the quad QQ and extract the reference image R.</li>
058 * <li>Step 4: Create the Lucas-Kanade matcher (forward or inverse).</li>
059 * <li>Step 5: Calculate the initial mapping Tinit from (centered) R &rarr; Q.</li>
060 * <li>Step 6: Calculate the real mapping from (centered) R &rarr; QQ (for validation only).</li>
061 * <li>Step 7: Initialize the matcher and run the matching loop.</li>
062 * <li>Step 8: Evaluate the results.</li>
063 * </ul>
064 * 
065 * @author WB
066 */
067public class LucasKanade_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
068        
069        static int maxIterations = 100;
070        static double tolerance = 0.0001;
071        static double sigma = 2.5;
072        static boolean drawBoundaries = true;
073        static boolean forwardMatcher = true;
074        
075        static {PrintPrecision.set(6);}
076        
077        ImagePlus im = null;
078        Overlay oly = null;
079
080        public int setup(String args, ImagePlus im) {
081                this.im = im;
082                return DOES_8G + ROI_REQUIRED;
083        }
084
085        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {            
086                Roi roi = im.getRoi();
087                if (roi != null && roi.getType() != Roi.RECTANGLE) {
088                        IJ.error("Rectangular selection required!)");
089                        return;
090                }
091                
092                // Step 1: Create the search image I:
093                FloatProcessor I = ip.convertToFloatProcessor();
094                
095                // Step 2: Create the (empty) reference image $R$:
096                Rectangle roiR = roi.getBounds();
097                FloatProcessor R = new FloatProcessor(roiR.width, roiR.height);
098                
099                // Step 3: Perturb the ROI corners to form the quad QQ and extract the reference image R:
100                Pnt2d[] Q  = getCornerPoints(roiR);
101                Pnt2d[] QQ = perturbGaussian(Q);
102                (new ImageExtractor(I)).extractImage(R, QQ);
103                //(new ImagePlus("R", R)).show();
104                
105                // Step 4: Create the Lucas-Kanade matcher (forward or inverse):
106                LucasKanadeMatcher matcher = (forwardMatcher) ?
107                                new LucasKanadeForwardMatcher(I, R) :
108                                new LucasKanadeInverseMatcher(I, R);
109                
110                // Step 5: Calculate the initial mapping Tinit from (centered) R -> Q:
111                ProjectiveMapping2D Tinit = matcher.getReferenceMappingTo(Q);
112                IJ.log("Tinit = " + Matrix.toString(matcher.getParameters(Tinit)));
113
114                // Step 6: Calculate the real mapping from (centered) R -> QQ (for validation only):
115                ProjectiveMapping2D Treal = matcher.getReferenceMappingTo(QQ);
116                IJ.log("Treal = " + Matrix.toString(matcher.getParameters(Treal)));
117                
118                // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
119                // Step 7: Initialize the matcher and run the matching loop:
120                ProjectiveMapping2D T = Tinit;
121                do {
122                        T = matcher.iterateOnce(T);             // returns null if iteration failed
123                        int i = matcher.getIteration();
124                        double err = matcher.getRmsError();
125                        IJ.log(String.format("Iteration = %d, RMS error = %.2f", i , err));
126                } 
127                while (T != null && !matcher.hasConverged() && 
128                                matcher.getIteration() < maxIterations);
129                // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
130                
131                // Step 8: Evaluate the results:
132                if (T == null || !matcher.hasConverged()) {
133                        IJ.log("no match found!");
134                        return;
135                }
136                else {
137                        ProjectiveMapping2D Tfinal = T;
138                        
139                        IJ.log(" ++++++++++++++++ Summary +++++++++++++++++++");
140                        // convert all mappings to projective (for comparison)
141                        ProjectiveMapping2D TinitP = new ProjectiveMapping2D(Tinit);
142                        ProjectiveMapping2D TrealP = new ProjectiveMapping2D(Treal);
143                        ProjectiveMapping2D TfinalP = new ProjectiveMapping2D(Tfinal);
144                        IJ.log("Matcher type: " + matcher.getClass().getSimpleName());
145                        IJ.log("Match found after " + matcher.getIteration() + " iterations.");
146                        IJ.log("Final RMS error " + matcher.getRmsError());
147                        IJ.log("  Tinit  = " + Matrix.toString(matcher.getParameters(TinitP)));
148                        IJ.log("  Treal  = " + Matrix.toString(matcher.getParameters(TrealP)));
149                        IJ.log("  Tfinal = " + Matrix.toString(matcher.getParameters(TfinalP)));
150        
151                        IJ.log("Corners of reference patch:");
152                        Pnt2d[] ptsRef = Treal.applyTo(matcher.getReferencePoints());
153                        for(Pnt2d pt : ptsRef) {
154                                IJ.log("  pt = " + pt.toString());
155                        }
156                        IJ.log("Corners for best match:");
157                        Pnt2d[] ptsFinal = Tfinal.applyTo(matcher.getReferencePoints());
158                        for(Pnt2d pt : ptsFinal) {
159                                IJ.log("  pt = " + pt.toString());
160                        }
161                        
162                        Pnt2d test0 = PntInt.from(0, 0);
163                        IJ.log(" (0,0) by Treal  = " + Treal.applyTo(test0).toString());
164                        IJ.log(" (0,0) by Tfinal = " + Tfinal.applyTo(test0).toString());
165                        
166                        if (drawBoundaries) {
167                                oly = new Overlay();
168                                im.setOverlay(null);
169                                im.setOverlay(oly);
170                                
171                                oly.add(makePolygon(Q, 0.2, Color.green));
172                                oly.add(makePolygon(QQ, 0.5, Color.blue));
173                                oly.add(makePolygon(ptsFinal, 0.2, Color.red));
174                                im.updateAndDraw();
175                        }
176                }
177        }
178        
179        // ----------------------------------------------------------
180        
181        private Pnt2d[] getCornerPoints(Rectangle2D r) {        
182                //IJ.log("getpoints2:  r = " + r.toString());
183                double x = r.getX();
184                double y = r.getY();
185                double w = r.getWidth();
186                double h = r.getHeight();
187                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[4];
188                pts[0] = PntDouble.from(x, y);
189                pts[1] = PntDouble.from(x + w - 1, y);  // TODO: does -1 matter? YES - it seems WRONG!!!
190                pts[2] = PntDouble.from(x + w - 1, y + h - 1);
191                pts[3] = PntDouble.from(x, y + h - 1);
192                //IJ.log("getpoints2:  p1-4 = " + pts[0] + ", " + pts[1] + ", " + pts[2] + ", " + pts[3]);
193                return pts;
194        }
195        
196        private final Random rg = new Random();
197        
198        private Pnt2d perturbGaussian(Pnt2d p) {
199                double x = p.getX();
200                double y = p.getY();
201                x = x + rg.nextGaussian() * sigma;
202                y = y + rg.nextGaussian() * sigma;
203                return PntDouble.from(x, y);
204        }
205        
206        private Pnt2d[] perturbGaussian(Pnt2d[] pntsIn) {
207                Pnt2d[] pntsOut = pntsIn.clone();
208                for (int i = 0; i < pntsIn.length; i++) {
209                        pntsOut[i] = perturbGaussian(pntsIn[i]);
210                }
211                return pntsOut;
212        }
213        
214        private Roi makePolygon(Pnt2d[] points, double strokeWidth, Color color) {
215                Path2D poly = new Path2D.Double();
216                if (points.length > 0) {
217                        poly.moveTo(points[0].getX(), points[0].getY());
218                        for (int i = 1; i < points.length; i++) {
219                                poly.lineTo(points[i].getX(), points[i].getY());
220                        }
221                        poly.closePath();
222                }
223                Roi shapeRoi = new ShapeRoi(poly);
224                shapeRoi.setStrokeWidth(strokeWidth);
225                shapeRoi.setStrokeColor(color);
226                return shapeRoi;
227        }
228
229}
